Package tk.borroot.player.reinforcement.qlearning

Class PlayerQlearning

  • java.lang.Object
    • tk.borroot.player.Player
      • tk.borroot.player.reinforcement.qlearning.PlayerQlearning
  • public class PlayerQlearning
extends Player
    This class represents a player which plays using Q-learning!
    Author:
    Bram Pulles

    • Field Detail

      • LEARNING_RATE

        private final float LEARNING_RATE
        The learning rate (alpha) and the discount factor (gamma) they range in [0,1].

      • DISCOUNT_FACTOR

        private final float DISCOUNT_FACTOR
        The learning rate (alpha) and the discount factor (gamma) they range in [0,1].

      • START_DEGRADATION

        private final int START_DEGRADATION
        The n'th round where the epsilon value will start to decrease and where the epsilon value will reach zero. Between the start and the end the value will decrease uniformly.

      • END_DEGRADATION

        private final int END_DEGRADATION
        The n'th round where the epsilon value will start to decrease and where the epsilon value will reach zero. Between the start and the end the value will decrease uniformly.

      • exploration

        private float exploration
        The exploration value (epsilon) which describes the amount of random moves to be made.

      • DEGRADATION_PER_ROUND

        private final float DEGRADATION_PER_ROUND
        The average decrease with every round of the exploration value.

      • round

        private int round
        It is currently the n'th round.

      • moved

        private java.util.Vector<Triplet<Board,​java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Boolean>> moved
        This variable represents all the moves qlearning made during the last game. It also has a field to say if the board was swapped yes or no, this is very useful for the learning function.The value will be reset at the end of every game.

      • table

        private java.util.HashMap<Board,​Actions> table
        This variable represents the qlearning table with all the states and all the actions which can be made from a given state. All the states are made in such a way that every game was started by player 'X'. This means that when making a move the board needs to be swapped if the first player was not 'X'.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerQlearning

        public PlayerQlearning()

    • Method Detail

      • processState

        private boolean processState​(Board board)
        Add the board to the table hashmap with a new actions object if it is not already in there.
        Parameters:
        board - to be added to the table
        Returns:
        if the board was already in the table hashmap

      • searchStates

        private void searchStates​(Board board,
                          boolean onturn)
        Search for all the states which can be reached and add these to the table hashmap. This is done in a depth first search manner. We also check for all the possible transformations of the board and only add the unique ones to the table hashmap.
        Parameters:
        board - to be further explored
        onturn - true means 'X', false means 'O'

      • first

        private boolean first​(Board board)
        Check if this player started with this game.
        Parameters:
        board - the board to be checked
        Returns:
        if this player started the game corresponding to this board

      • needsSwap

        private boolean needsSwap​(Board board)
        Check if the board needs to be swapped such that the first move was done by a 'X'. This is needed because the states hashmap is made with 'X' starting.
        Parameters:
        board - to be swapped yes or no
        Returns:
        if the board needs to be swapped

      • move

        public int move​(Board board)
        Description copied from class: Player
        This function will be asked to players when they can make a move.
        Specified by:
        move in class Player
        Parameters:
        board - to be made a move on
        Returns:
        a value in [0..8] which corresponds to the move

      • maxFuture

        private float maxFuture​(Board board,
                        int move,
                        boolean swapped)
        Get the maximum value for the future. This value is calculated by first making the move on the board and then taking the maximum value of all actions from this new board.
        Parameters:
        board - to be made a move on
        move - to be made on the board
        swapped - if the board was swapped before
        Returns:
        the max value of the new board

      • learn

        public void learn​(Player winner)
        Description copied from class: Player
        This function will be called at the end of each game. This function should activate the learning mechanism of the reinforcement learning algorithms.
        Specified by:
        learn in class Player
        Parameters:
        winner - who won the last game (with this board)
